transportAdvice: Basel has an extensive tram and bus network that connects the city centre with most tourist areas, making public transit the most practical way to get around beyond walking. The compact old town is highly walkable, and taxis are readily available though expensive, as is typical in Switzerland.

weather.description: Cold and often grey with occasional frost; pack warm layers and expect limited daylight hours.
Still cold but days begin to lengthen slightly; snow is possible though not guaranteed.
Early spring brings milder temperatures and occasional sunny spells mixed with rain showers.
Pleasant spring weather with blooming trees, though showers remain frequent throughout the month.
Warm and green with longer days; one of the more enjoyable months to visit despite occasional rain.
Early summer is warm and lively; expect some thunderstorms but generally good conditions for sightseeing.
The warmest month with long sunny days; occasional thunderstorms can bring brief but heavy downpours.
Warm summer conditions continue with a mix of sunshine and afternoon storms; Rhine swimming is popular.
Early autumn brings cooler evenings and pleasant daytime temperatures ideal for exploring the city.
Autumn colours emerge and temperatures drop noticeably; fog can settle in the Rhine valley.
Cool and often overcast with increasing fog; the city's Christmas markets begin to open late in the month.
Cold and festive with Christmas markets in full swing; snow is possible but rain is more common.
